string-array.name: data_desc
string-array.item: Kim Jun-myeon, better known by his stage name Suho is a South Korean singer, songwriter and actor. He is currently the leader and main vocalist of the South Korean-Chinese boy group EXO and its subunit EXO-K.

Kim Min-seok, or better known by his stage name Xiumin, is a South Korean singer and actor. He is known as a member of the South Korean-Chinese music group EXO, along with its subunits EXO-M and EXO-CBX. He debuted as a soloist on September 26, 2022 with the release of his EP, Brand New.

Zhang Yixing, better known by his stage name Lay Zhang or simply Lay, is a Chinese singer, rapper, songwriter, dancer and actor. He debuted in 2012 as a member of the South Korean-Chinese boy group EXO and its subunit EXO-M under SM Entertainment.

Byun Baek-hyun, or better known by the mononym Baekhyun is a South Korean singer, songwriter and actor. In 2012, Baekhyun debuted as a member of the South Korean-Chinese group EXO. He is also a member of two EXO subunits, namely EXO-K and EXO-CBX. He is also the leader of the SuperM group.

Kim Jong-dae, or better known by his stage name, Chen, is a South Korean singer and songwriter. He debuted in 2012 as a member and main vocalist of the South Korean-Chinese boy group EXO, and its subunit EXO-M.
Park Chan-yeol, better known by the mononym Chanyeol is a South Korean rapper, singer, songwriter and actor. He is a member of the Chinese-South Korean boy group EXO and its sub-group EXO-K.
Doh Kyung-soo, also professionally known as D.O., is a South Korean singer and actor, best known as a member of the South Korean-Chinese boy group Exo
Kim Jong-in, or better known as Kai, is a South Korean singer, actor and dancer. He is a member of the South Korean-Chinese singing group EXO and its subgroup EXO-K.
Oh Se-hun, better known by his mononym Sehun, is a South Korean singer, rapper, model and actor. He is best known as a member of the South Korean-Chinese boy band EXO and its sub-group EXO-K.

Wu Yi Fan, known as Kris Wu, is a Chinese Canadian actor, singer, record producer, and model. He was a former member of the South Korean-Chinese boy band EXO and its subgroup EXO-M under SM Entertainment, before leaving the group in 2014.
Lu Han is a singer from China. He is a former member of EXO-M, a subgroup of the Chinese-South Korean boy band EXO. He is the main singer and dancer of the group.

Huang Zitao, better known by his nickname TAO, is a Chinese singer, rapper, songwriter, actor and martial artist. He has been practicing Wushu since he was 5 years old. He is a former member of the K-pop boy band EXO, sub-unit EXO-M with the position of Lead Rapper and the image "Fighter".

Lead Vocalist, Lead Dancer, Visual, Face of The Group
Lead Rapper, Lead Dancer, Sub Vocalist

string-array.name: data_facts
string-array.item:
– He lives in the Apujeong neighborhood of Seoul, South Korea.
– He has an older brother, Kim Dongkyu (4 years older).
– He became an SM trainee in 2006 when he was 16.
– He says out of all of the EXO members, he’s the best at public speaking.
– He is very polite and considerate.

– Hometown: Guri, Gyeonggi province.
– Xiumin has a little sister whose identity he worked very hard to keep a secret.
– He became an SM trainee in 2008.
– Specialty: taekwondo, fencing, kendo, and soccer.
– Though his looks make him appear as the youngest member, he is actually the oldest.

- Hometown: Changsha, Hunan, China. 
- He’s an only child
- He used to be a local child star in China.
- He became an SM trainee in 2008 when he was 16
- Specialties: Guitar, dancing, piano.

– Hometown: Bucheon, Gyeonggi Province, South Korea.
– He has an older brother named Byun Baekbeom.– He officially joined SM in 2011.
– His popular nickname is “Bacon”.
– Personality: he is a bright, cheerful, childlike person.

– Hometown: Siheung, Gyeonggi province.
– He has an older brother.
– He became an SM Entertainment trainee in 2011.
– The thing he is best at is singing high-notes.
– Has a humorous and very playful personality.

– Hometown: Seoul, South Korea.
– He has a sister, Park Yoo-ra, who used to be a news anchor (3 years older).
– He became an SM Entertainment trainee in 2008.
– Specialties: Playing musical instruments (guitar, drum, bass, djembe), rap, acting.
– He is always cheerful and bright.

- Hometown: Goyang, Gyeonggi Province, South Korea.
– He has an older brother, Do Seungsoo.
- He became a SM trainee in 2010.
- Specialties: Singing, beat box, acting.
- He has a habit of humming songs.

- Hometown: Suncheon, South Jeolla Province/Jeollanam-do, S. Korea.
- Has 2 older sisters (one 9 years older and another 5 years older).
- He became a SM trainee in 2007, when he was 13.
- Specialties: Dance (ballet, jazz, hip hop, popping, rocking).
- He loves playing video games.

- Hometown: Seoul, South Korea.
- He has an older brother (3 years older).
- He became a SM trainee in 2008, when he was 14.
- Specialties: Dancing, acting
- His favorite foods are meat and sushi

He was born in Guangzhou, Guangdong province, China, but at age of 10 moved to Vancouver, Canada.
– Kris’ birth name is Li Jiaheng and his name was changed to Wu Yifan for personal reasons.
– He is fluent in 4 languages: English, Cantonese, Mandarin, and Korean.
– Specialties: Languages and Basketball.
– He’s very social and can talk to anyone.

– He was born in Haidian District, Beijing, China.
– He’s an only child.
– Auditioned to be a trainee for JYP Entertainment but was not accepted.
– He likes girls who are demure and quiet.
– He likes simple clothes.

– He was born in Qingdao, Shandong province, China.
– He’s an only child.
– Nickname: Peach, Kung Fu Panda.
– He loves the color blue, Western food, basketball and black cat.
– His favorite music genre is hip hop and RandB.
